Subjective: Right eye irritation since Tuesday morning. Woke up with it. Rubbed eye initially, thought speck of dust/hair. Right eye now redder, more prominent veins than left. Feels like constant hair/speck of dust in eye. Pain when squeezing eyes shut tightly. No trauma, no new cosmetics. No prior eye issues. Daughter (Isa) has been cuddling. No vision changes, no photophobia. No flu/systemic illness. Social: Working, lives with boyfriend (currently on holiday for 10 days), has young daughter. ICE: Wants to know if it's normal infection, needs drops/antibiotics, worried about contagiousness, worsening pain/pus.
Objective: Right eye: Redness, prominent conjunctival vessels. Left eye: Mild redness noted. Pupils: Equal, round, reactive to light bilaterally. Visual acuity: Normal bilaterally. No discharge noted.
Plan: 1. Explanation: Viral conjunctivitis, self-limiting, usually resolves within 1-2 weeks. 2. Advice: Avoid rubbing eye. Lukewarm tap water cleansing for morning crusting. Artificial tears PRN for comfort. 3. Safety Netting: Return if worsening pain, increased pus/discharge, eye stuck shut, or vision changes. 4. Follow-up: Return in 2 weeks if symptoms persist.
